author: talkSPORT
title: Antoine Griezmann: ‘Arsenal are a wonderful team, but I’m staying at Atletico Madrid…sorry’
description: Antoine Griezmann will NOT be joining Arsenal - despite France team-mate Laurent Koscielny pestering him to make the move. Griezmann was in stunning form for Atletico Madrid and France last season, and it recently saw him finish third, behind Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi, in the 2016 Ballon d'Or award. It has led to the forward being linked with a big-money move to England, with both Arsenal and Manchester United huge admirers of the 25-year-old.

author: Alex Varney
title: LISTEN: Mino Raiola tells talkSPORT Romelu Lukaku 'has 99 per cent agreed' new Everton deal but admits striker could still leave next summer
description: Romelu Lukaku's agent, Mino Raiola, has confirmed to talkSPORT that his client is on the verge of signing a new and improved contract with Everton. Speaking to Jim White on Wednesday morning, Raiola revealed talks with the club were progressing well and he expects a deal to be done. “With Everton, we have 99.9 per cent reached terms," he said. "We are talking to the club in a good spirit so we are very hopeful. "There are no problems on the way that I foresee. "I don't see any big problems. It is a question of putting the details on the paper."

author: talkSPORT
title: Championship 2016/17 table: Super Computer predicts end of season final places
description: So, Newcastle United will top the Championship at Christmas. We are one game short of the halfway point in English football's second division and it has been eventful. While the top two have opened up a gap ahead of third - second-placed Brighton are eight points in front of Reading - and just nine points separates the Royals and 13th-placed Aston Villa. So many sub-plots are being created, with both the top and bottom of the table tough to call.

author: talkSPORT
title: Leicester City news: Premier League champions unsuccessful in Jamie Vardy red card appeal, striker to serve three-match ban
description: Jamie Vardy will miss Leicester's next three games after an appeal against his red card against Stoke was rejected by an independent regulatory commission. Vardy was dismissed for a two-footed challenge on Mame Diouf, which referee Craig Pawson deemed to be reckless despite connecting with the ball first. A short disciplinary statement from the Football Association read: "Jamie Vardy will serve a three-match suspension with immediate effect after his wrongful dismissal claim was rejected.

title: Football sex abuse scandal: Police say there are 429 potential victims aged between four and 20

"We are talking to the club in a good spirit so we are very hopeful. "There are no problems on the way that I foresee. "I don't see any big problems. It is a question of putting the details on the paper."

author: talkSPORT
title: Football sex abuse scandal: Police say there are 429 potential victims aged between four and 20
description: The age range for potential victims in the football child abuse scandal starts at four years old, the National Police Chiefs' Council has announced. The scale of the scandal continues to grow as the latest figures from the NPCC show significant increases in the numbers of clubs implicated, referrals, suspects and victims. According to the information gathered by Operation Hydrant, the UK-wide police investigation into non-recent child sexual abuse, 148 clubs are now involved, with 155 potential suspects and 429 victims, aged between four and 20.

author: Joe Moore
title: LISTEN: 'I struggled with the limelight, but now I’ve got the right people behind me' – Jack Grealish focused on turning around Aston Villa career
description: Jack Grealish has told talkSPORT he is committed to turning around his career at Aston Villa after he ‘struggled to handle’ his Premier League breakthrough. The talented youngster was a revelation at the Midlands club when brought into the first-team by former manager Tim Sherwood at the age of 18. But, akin to his club’s fall from the top flight, Grealish’s career also took a downward spiral as he hit the headlines for all the wrong reasons over the next few years.

author: talkSPORT
title: Antoine Griezmann: ‘Arsenal are a wonderful team, but I’m staying at Atletico Madrid…sorry’
description: Antoine Griezmann will NOT be joining Arsenal - despite France team-mate Laurent Koscielny pestering him to make the move. Griezmann was in stunning form for Atletico Madrid and France last season, and it recently saw him finish third, behind Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi, in the 2016 Ballon d'Or award. It has led to the forward being linked with a big-money move to England, with both Arsenal and Manchester United huge admirers of the 25-year-old.

author: talkSPORT
title: Leicester City news: Premier League champions unsuccessful in Jamie Vardy red card appeal, striker to serve three-match ban
description: Jamie Vardy will miss Leicester's next three games after an appeal against his red card against Stoke was rejected by an independent regulatory commission. Vardy was dismissed for a two-footed challenge on Mame Diouf, which referee Craig Pawson deemed to be reckless despite connecting with the ball first. A short disciplinary statement from the Football Association read: "Jamie Vardy will serve a three-match suspension with immediate effect after his wrongful dismissal claim was rejected.

author: talkSPORT
title: Chelsea FC's Steve Holland confirmed as Gareth Southgate's assistant manager for England
description: Chelsea assistant coach Steve Holland will become England's assistant manager, the Football Association has announced. More to follow...

author: talkSPORT
title: Championship 2016/17 table: Super Computer predicts end of season final places
description: So, Newcastle United will top the Championship at Christmas. We are one game short of the halfway point in English football's second division and it has been eventful. While the top two have opened up a gap ahead of third - second-placed Brighton are eight points in front of Reading - and just nine points separates the Royals and 13th-placed Aston Villa. So many sub-plots are being created, with both the top and bottom of the table tough to call.

author: Charli Casey
title: Transfer news: Power ranking the top 15 summer signings of the Premier League
description: With almost half of the season gone, it's time to really assess the success of summer business. We've seen a selection of top talent take to a new home in the Premier League, and some have settled with ease, clearly influencing their side's style of play. But which player should take the honour as being labelled the best signing of the summer transfer window, so far?
